title: 22.红岸之五
paragraphs: 自从进入红岸基地后，叶文洁就没有想到能够出去。在得知红岸工程真实目的后（这个绝密信息是基地许多中层干部都不知道的），她把与外界精神上的联系也斩断了，只是埋头于工作。这以后，她更深地介入到红岸系统的技术接心，开始承担比较重要的研究课题。对于杨卫宁给予叶文洁的信任，雷志成一直耿耿于怀，但他还是很愿意将重要课题交到叶文洁手上——以叶文洁的身份，她对自己的研究成果没有任何权利；而基地中，只有雷志成是天体物理专业出身的，是当时少见的知识分子政委；这样，叶文洁的成果和论文最后都被他占去，使他成了部队政工干部中又红又专的典型。
调叶文洁进入红岸基地的最初缘由，是她读研究生时发表在《天文学学报》上的那篇试图建立太阳数学模型的论文。其实，与地球相比，太阳是一个更简单的物理系统，只是由氢和氦这两种很简单的元素构成。它的物理过程虽然剧烈，但十分单纯。只是氢至氦的聚变，所以，有可能建立一个数学模型来对太阳进行较为准确的描述。那论文本来是一篇很基础的东西，但杨卫宁和雷志成却从中看到了解决红岸监听系统一个技术难题的希望。

凌日干扰问题一直困扰着红岸的监听操作。这个名词是从刚出现的通信卫星技术中借来的，当地球、卫星和太阳处于同一条直线时，地面接收天线对准的卫星是以太阳为背景的。太阳是一个巨大的电磁发射源，这时地面接收的卫星微波就会受到太阳电磁辐射强烈干扰。这个问题后来直到二十一世纪都无法解决。红岸所受到的日凌干扰与此类似，不同的是干扰源（太阳）位于发射源（外太空）和接收器之间，与通信卫星相比，红岸所受的凌日干扰出现的时间更频繁，也更严重。实际的红岸系统又比原设计缩水了许多，监听和发射系统共用一个天线。这使得监听的时间较为珍贵，日凌干扰也就成为一个严重问题了。

扬卫宁和雷志成的想法很简单：搞清太阳发射的电磁渡在监测波段上的频谱规律和特征，用数字滤波滤掉它，就可捧除干扰。两人都是技术专家，在这外行领导内行的年代，这是难能可贵的。但杨卫宁不是天体物理专业的，雷志成则是走政工道路的人，在专业上不可能知道得太深。其实太阳电磁辐射的稳定只局限于包括可见光在内的从近紫外到中红外波段，在其他的波段上，它的辐射是动荡不定的。叶文洁首先明智地在第一份研究报告中明确一点：在太阳黑子、艘斑、日冕物质抛射等太阳剧烈爆发性活动期间，日凌干扰无法排除。于是，研究对象只局限于太阳正常活动时红岸监测波段内的电磁辐射。
基地内的研究条件还是不错的，资料室可以按课题内容调来较全的外文资料，还有很及时的欧美学术期刊，在那个年代这是件很不容易的事。叶文洁还可以通过军线，与中科院两家研究太阳的科研单位联系，通过传真得到他们的实时观测数据。十八岁给我一个姑娘小说

叶文洁的研究持续了半年，丝毫看不到成功的希望。她很快发现，在红岸的观测频率范围内，太阳的辐射变幻莫测。通过对大量观测数据的分析，叶文洁发现了令她迷惑的神秘之处：有时，上述某一频段辐射发生突变时，太阳表面活动却平静如常，上千次的观测数据都证实了这一点。这就很令她费解了。短波和微波频段的辐射不可能穿透几十万公里的太阳表层来自太阳核心，只能是太阳表层活动产生的，当突变发生时，这种活动应该能够观测到。如果太阳没有相应的扰动，这狭窄频段的突变是什么引起的？这事让她越想越觉得神秘。

研究到了山穷水尽的地步，叶文洁决定放弃了，她在最后一份报告中承认自己无能为力。这件事情应该比较好交待的，军方委托中科院的几个单位和大学进行的类似研究都以失败告终，杨卫宁不过是想借助于叶文洁的过人才华再试一试。而雷志成的真实想法就更简单了，他只想要叶文洁的论文。这项研究理论性很强，更能显示出他的水平和层次。现在，社会上疯狂的浪潮渐渐平息，对干部的要求也有了一些变化，像他这样在政治上成熟、学术上又有造诣的人，是奇缺的，当然前途无量。至于日凌问题是否能够解决，倒不是他最关心的。夜旅人小说
但叶文洁最终还是没有把报告交上去，她想到，如果研究结束，基地资料室为这个课题进行的资料调集和外文期刊订阅就会停止，她就再也不可能接触到这么丰富的天体物理学资料了。于是她在名义上还是将研究进行下去，实际上潜心搞自己的太阳数学模型。西夏死书小说
这天夜里，资料室寒冷的阅览室照例只有叶文洁一人，她面前的长桌上摊开了一堆期刊和文献，完成一段繁琐的矩阵计算后，她呵呵冻的手，合起了一本最新一期《天体物理学》杂志，仅仅是作为休息，随便翻了翻，一篇关于木星研究的论文引起了她的注意，论文的提要如下：

在上期的短讯《太阳系内新的强发射源》中，威尔逊山天文台的哈里。比德森博士公布了一批数据，是有关他在6月12日和7月2日对木星由行星引力导致的自转摆动观测中，意外两次检测到木星本身发出强烈的电磁辐射，每次持续时间分别为81秒和76秒，这批数据记录了辐射的频率范围和其他参数。在射电爆发期间，观测到木星表面大红斑状态的某些变化，比德森也在短讯中进行了描述。木星射电爆发在行星学术界引起很太兴趣，这期刊发的G·麦肯齐的文章，认为这是木星内部棱聚变启动的征兆；下期将刊发井上云石的文章，将木星射电爆发归结为一个更复杂的机制：内部金属氢板块的运动，并给出了完整的数学描述。

叶文洁清楚记得这两个日期和时间。当时，红岸监听系统受到了强烈的日凌干扰。她查了一下运行日志，证实了自己的记忆，只是来自太阳的日凌干扰比来自木星的电磁辐射到达地球的时间晚了十六分四十二秒。这关键的十六分四十二秒啊！叶文洁抑制住剧烈的心跳，请资料室的有关人员与国家天文台联系，得到了那两个时间木星和地球的位置坐标。她在黑板上画出了一个大大的三角形，三个顶点分别是太阳、地球和木星。她在三条边上分别标上距离，在地球顶点标上了两个到达时间。由木星到地球的距离很容易算出电磁辐射由木星直接到达地球消耗的时间。

她接着又算出了电磁辐射由木星到达太阳，再由太阳到达地球的时间，两者相差正是十六分四十二秒！叶文洁翻出了以前自己搞出的太阳结构数学模型，试图从理论上找到一些蛛丝马迹。她的目光很快锁定在太阳辐射层中一种叫“能量镜面”的东西。从日核反应区发出的能量开始是以高能伽马射线的形式发出，辐射区通过对这些高能粒子的吸收，再发射实现能量传递，经过无数次这种再吸引再辐射的漫长过程（一个光子脱离太阳可能需要一千年的时间），高能伽马射线经过X射线，极紫外线，紫外线逐渐变为可见光和其他形式的辐射。这些是在太阳研究中早已明确的内容。叶文洁的数学模型产生的一个新结果是：在这些不同频率辐射的转换之间，存在着许多明显的界面，辐射区由里向外，每越过一个界面，辐射频率就明显下降一个等级，这与传统观点认为辐射区的频率是渐变的有所不同。计算表明，这种界面会将来自低频侧的辐射反射回去，于是她就想了那么一个命名。
叶文洁开始仔细研究这一层层悬浮在太阳电浆海洋中的飘忽不定的薄膜，她发现，这种只能在恒星内部的高能海洋中出现的东西，有许多奇妙的性质，其中最不可思议的是它的“增益反射”特性。而这与太阳电磁辐射之谜似乎有关，但这种特性过分离奇，难以证实，叶文洁自己都难以置信，更有可能是令人目眩的复杂计算中产生的一些误导所致。
现在，叶文洁初步证实了自己关于太阳能量镜面增益反射的猜想：能量镜面并非简单地反射低频侧的电磁辐射，而是将它放大了！以前观测到的那些在狭窄频段的神秘突变，其实是来自宇宙间的辐射被放大后的结果。所以在太阳表面观察不到任何相应的扰动。
很可能，这一次，太阳收到木星的电磁辐射后又发射出来，只是强度增加了近亿倍！地球以十六分四十二秒的时间差分别收到了放大前后的这两次辐射。
太阳是一个电波放大器！

这里出现一个问题：太阳每时每刻都在接收来自太空的电磁辐射，包括地球溢出的无线电波，为什么它只放大其中的一部分呢？原因很明显：除了能量镜面对反射频率的选择外，主要是太阳对流层的屏蔽作用。表面沸腾不息的对流层位于辐射层之上，是太阳最外一层液态层。来自太空的电波首先要穿透对流层才能到达辐射层的能量镜面，进而被放大后反射出去。这就需要射入的电波在功率上超过一个阈值，地球上的绝大部分的无线电发射都远低于这个阈值，但木星的电磁辐射超过了——红岸的最大发射功率也超过了这个阈值！
日凌干扰问题仍未得到解决，但另一个激动人心的可能性出现了：人类可以将太阳作为一个超级天线，通过它向宇宙中发射电波。这种电波是以恒星级的能量发出的，它的功率比地球上能够使用的全部发射功率还要大上亿倍。
地球文明有可能进行Ⅱ型文明能级的发射！
下一步，需要将那两次木星电磁辐射的波形与红岸受到的日凌干扰的波形相对照。如果吻合，这个猜想就得到了进一步的证实。
叶文洁向领导提出要求，要与哈里·比德森联系，取得那两次木星电磁辐射的波形记录。这不是一件容易的事情，渠道不好找，还有众多部门的一道道手续要办，弄岔一点就有里通外围的嫌疑，叶文洁只好等待。
但还有一个更直接的证实方法：红岸发射系统以超过那个阈值的功率直接向太阳发射电波。
叶文洁找到了领导，提出了这个要求，但没敢直接说出自己的想法，那太玄乎了，肯定遭到否决，她只是说这是一次对太阳研究进行的试验，将红岸发射系统作为对太阳的探测雷达，通过接收回波来分析反映太阳电磁辐射的一些信息。雷志成和杨卫宁都有很深的技术背景，想骗他们不容易，但叶文洁说出的这项试验，在西方太阳研究中确实有过先例。事实上，这比正在进行中的对类地行星的雷达探测在技术上还简单些。
“叶文洁呀，你越来越出格了，你的课题，在理论上搞搞就行了，有必要弄这么大动作吗？”雷志成摇摇头说。
“政委，可能有重大发现，实验是必须的。只这一次，行吗？”叶文洁苦苦央求道。
杨卫宁说：“雷政委，要不就做一次？操作上好像没什么太大困难，回波在发射后传回要……”
“十几分钟吧。”雷志成说。
“这样红岸系统正好有时间转换到接收状态。”
雷志成再次摇头，“我知道在技术和工作量上都没什么，但你……杨总啊，你头脑中缺的就是这根弦啊——向红太阳发射超强烈的电波，你想过这种试验的政治含义吗？”
杨卫宁和叶文洁一时瞠目结舌，他们并不是感到这理由荒唐，相反，是为自己没有想到而后怕。那个年代，对一切事物的政治图解已达了极其荒唐的程度。叶文洁上交的研究报告，雷志成必须进行仔细审阅，对有关太阳的技术用词反复斟酌修改，像“太阳黑子”这类词汇都不能出现。向太阳发射超强电波的实验当然可以做出一千个正面解释，但只要有一个反面解释，就可能有人面临灭顶之灾。雷志成拒绝实验的这个理由，确实是不可能被推翻的。
叶文洁没有放弃，其实只要冒不大的险，做成这事很容易。红岸发射系统的发射器是超高功率的设备，全部使用“文革”期间生产的国产元件，由于质量不过关，故障率很高，不得不在每十五次发射后就全面检修一次，每次检修完成后都要例行试运行，参加这种发射的人很少，目标和其他发射参数也是比较随意的。

在一次值班中，叶文洁被分配进行例行的检修后的测试。由于试发射省去了很多操作，在场的除叶丈洁外只有五个人，其中三个是对设备原理知之甚少的操作员，另外的一名技术员和一名工程师已在持续了两天的检修中疲惫不堪，心不在焉。叶文洁首先将发射功率设置到刚刚超过太阳增益反射理论上的阈值（这已是红岸发射系统的最大功率了），频率设定在最可能被能量镜面放大的频率上，借测试天线机械性能为名，将它对准已斜挂在西天的太阳，发射的内容仍同每次正规发射一样。

这是1971年秋天一个晴朗的下午。事后叶文洁多次回忆那一时刻，并没有什么特别的感觉，只是焦急，盼发射快些完成。一方面是怕在场的同事发现，虽然她想好了推托的理由。但以损耗元件的最大功率进行发射实验毕竟是不正常的；同时，红岸发射系统的定位设备不是设计用于瞄准太阳的，叶文洁用手就能感到光学系统在发烫。如果烧坏麻烦就大了。太阳在西天缓缓下落，叶文浩不得不手动跟踪。这时，红岸天线像一棵巨大的向日葵，面对着下落中的太阳缓缓转动。当发射完成的红灯亮起时，她浑身已被汗水浸透了。扭头一看，三名操作员正在控制台上按手册依次关闭设备。那名工程师在控制室的一角喝水，技术员则靠在长椅子上睡着了。不管后来的历史学家和文学家们如何描述，当时的真实情景就是这样平淡无奇。
发射一完成，叶文洁就冲出控制室，跑进杨卫宁的办公室，喘着气说：“快，让基地电台在12000兆赫上接收！”
“收什么？”杨总工程师惊奇地看着头发被汗水粘到脸上的叶文洁，与灵敏度极高的红岸接收系统相比，基地用于与外界联系的常规军用电台只是个玩具。
“也许能收到一些东西，红岸系统没有时间转换到接收状态了！”叶文洁说。正常情况下，红岸接收系统的预热和切换只需十多分钟，而现在接收系统也在检修中，很多模块拆卸后还未组装，根本无法在短时间内运行。杨卫宁看了叶文洁几秒钟，拿起了电话，吩咐机要通讯室按叶文洁说的去做。“那个电台的精度，大概只能收到月球上外星人的信号。”
“信号来自太阳。”叶文洁说。窗外，太阳的边缘已接近天边的山顶，血红血红的。
“你用红岸系统向太阳发信号了？”杨卫宁紧张地问。
叶文洁点点头。
“这事不要对别人说，下不为例，绝对的下不为例！”杨卫宁警觉地回头看看门口说。
叶文洁又点点头。
“这有什么意义嘛，回波一定是极弱的，远远超出了常规电台的接收能力。”
“不，如果我的猜想是正常的。将收到极强的回波，强得……难以想象，只要发射功率超过个阈值，太阳……就能成亿倍地放大电波！”
杨卫宁又奇怪地看着叶文洁，后者沉默了。两人静静地等着，杨卫宁能够清晰地听到叶文洁的呼吸和心跳，对她刚才的话他没太在意，只是埋藏了多少年的感情又涌上心头.但他只能控制着自己，等待着。二十分钟后，杨卫宁拿起电话，要通了通讯室，简单地问了两句。
“什么都没收到。”杨卫宁放下电话说。
叶文洁长出了一口气，好半天才点点头。

“那个美国天文学家回信了。/”杨卫宁拿出一个厚厚的信封递给叶文洁，上面盖满了海关的印章。叶文洁迫不及待地拆开信封，先是大概扫了一眼哈里。比德森的信，信上说他没有想到中国也有研究行星电磁学的同行，希望多多联系和合作。他寄来的是两叠纸，上面完整地记录了来自木星两次电磁辐射的波形。波形显然是从长条信号记录纸上复印下来的，要对起来看，而这个时候的中国人，还大多没有见过复印机。叶文洁将几十张复印纸在地板上排成两排，排到一半时她就已经不抱任何希望了，她太熟悉那两次日凌干扰的波形了，与这两条肯定对不上。
叶文洁慢慢地从地上将那两排复印纸收拾起来。杨卫宁蹲下帮她收拾，当他将手中的一打纸递给这个他的内心深处爱着的姑娘时，看到她摇摇头笑了一下，那笑很凄婉，令他心颤。
“怎么？”他轻轻地问，没有意识到自己同她说话从来没有这么轻声过。
“没什么，一场梦，醒了而已。”叶文洁说完又笑了笑，抱着那摞复印纸和信封走出了办公室。她回到住处，取了饭盒去食堂，才发现只剩下馒头和咸菜了。食堂的人又没好气地告诉她要关门了，她只好端着饭盒走了出来，走到那道悬崖前，坐在草地上啃着凉馒头。
这时太阳已经落山，大兴安岭看上去是灰蒙蒙的一片，就像叶文洁的生活。在这灰色中，梦尤其显得绚丽灿烂。但梦总是很快会醒的，就像那轮太阳，虽然还会升起来，已不带有新的希望。这时叶文洁突然看到了自己的后半生，也只有无际的灰色。她含着眼泪，又笑了笑，继续啃凉馒头。
叶文洁不知道，就在这时，地球文明向太空发出的第一声能够被听到的啼鸣，已经以太阳为中心，以光速飞向整个宇宙。恒星级功率的强劲电波，如磅礴的海潮，此时已越过了木星轨道。
这时，在12000兆赫波段上，太阳是银河系中最亮的一颗星。

translated_paragraphs: Since entering the Red Shore Base, Ye Wenjie never thought of leaving. After learning the true purpose of the Red Shore Project (a top-secret piece of information that many middle-level干部 in the base were not aware of), she cut off all external spiritual connections and focused solely on her work. From then on, she became more deeply involved in the technical core of the Red Shore System and began to take on more important research projects. For Yang Weining's trust in Ye Wenjie, Lei Zhi Cheng has always been resentful, but he is still willing to entrust important课题 to Ye Wenjie - as a member of the Red Shore System, she has no rights over her own research results; and in the base, only Lei Zhi Cheng was a born astronomer and a rare intellectual political commissar; as a result, Ye Wenjie's achievements and papers were all taken by him, making him a typical model of a red and specialized political commissar in the military.

The initial reason for recruiting Ye Wenhui to the Red Shore Base was a paper she had published in the Journal of the Chinese Astronomical Society while she was a graduate student. In fact, compared to the Earth, the Sun is a much simpler physical system, consisting only of hydrogen and helium, which are very simple elements. Its physical processes are intense, but very simple. It is only the fusion of hydrogen to helium, so it is possible to establish a mathematical model to describe the Sun more accurately. The paper was originally a very basic piece of work, but Yang Weining and Lei Zhi Cheng saw hope in it for solving a technical problem of the Red Shore Listening System.

The "lunar eclipse interference" has been a persistent problem for the monitoring operations of the Red Shore. This term was borrowed from the newly emerged satellite communication technology, where the ground receiving antenna is aligned with the satellite when the Earth, satellite, and Sun are on the same line. The Sun is a huge electromagnetic emission source, and at this time, the microwave signal received by the ground receiving antenna from the satellite is strongly interfered by the solar electromagnetic radiation. This problem could not be solved until the 21st century. The lunar eclipse interference experienced by the Red Shore is similar, but the interference source (Sun) is located between the emission source (outer space) and the receiver, and the lunar eclipse interference experienced by the Red Shore is more frequent and severe than that experienced by communication satellites. In fact, the actual Red Shore system is much smaller than the original design, with the monitoring and emission systems sharing a single antenna. This makes the time for monitoring precious, and the lunar eclipse interference becomes a serious problem.

Yang Weining and Lei Zhicheng's idea was simple: to clarify the spectral规律 and characteristics of electromagnetic radiation emitted by the sun in the monitoring band, use digital filtering to remove it, and the interference can be eliminated. Both of them are technical experts. In this era of "outsiders leading experts," this is a rare thing. But Yang Weining is not a professional in astrophysics, while Lei Zhicheng is a person who has taken the path of political and public work. In terms of professional knowledge, it is impossible to know too much. In fact, the stability of solar electromagnetic radiation is limited to the near-ultraviolet to mid-infrared bands, and in other bands, its radiation is fluctuating. Ye Wenjie first wisely pointed out in the first research report that during periods of intense solar explosive activities such as sunspots, filaments, and coronal mass ejections, solar interference cannot be eliminated. Therefore, the research object is limited to the electromagnetic radiation in the red岸 monitoring band during normal solar activity.

The research conditions within the base were still relatively good. The library could retrieve foreign language materials on various topics, and there were also very timely academic journals from Europe and the United States. This was a very difficult thing to do in those days. Ye Wenjie could also contact two scientific research units of the Chinese Academy of Sciences through the military line and obtain their real-time observation data by fax at the age of 18. A novel about a girl gave me a daughter at the age of 18.

Yan Wenchao's research lasted for half a year, with no hope of success in sight. She soon discovered that the radiation of the sun was unpredictable within the observation frequency range of Red岸. Through the analysis of a large amount of observational data, Yan Wenchao discovered a mysterious aspect that puzzled her: Sometimes, when a certain frequency band of radiation changed suddenly, the activity on the surface of the sun was as calm as usual, and thousands of observations confirmed this. This was very difficult for her to understand. The radiation of short waves and microwaves cannot penetrate tens of thousands of kilometers of the sun's surface from the sun's core, but can only be produced by activity on the sun's surface. When a sudden change occurs, this activity should be observable. If the sun has no corresponding disturbance, what is the sudden change in this narrow frequency band caused? This made her feel more and more mysterious.

At the point of being completely out of resources, Ye Wenjie decided to give up and admitted in her final report that she was unable to do anything. This matter should be relatively easy to explain. Research conducted by several units and universities of the CAS on similar topics under the military's commission all ended in failure. Yang Weining simply wanted to try again with Ye Wenjie's exceptional talent. And Lei Zhi Cheng's true thoughts were even simpler. He only wanted Ye Wenjie's paper. This research had a strong theoretical basis and could better demonstrate his level and level. Now, the狂热的 wave in society is gradually subsiding, and there are some changes in the requirements for cadres. People like him, who are politically mature and have academic achievements, are scarce, and of course have a bright future. Whether the issue of solar eclipses can be solved is not the most important thing to him. Night Traveler novel

But Ye Wenjie ultimately did not submit the report. She thought that if the research ended, the资料室 for this project would stop collecting and subscribing to foreign periodicals, and she would never be able to access such a rich collection of astronomical physics materials again. So she continued to conduct the research on paper, while actually focusing on her sun mathematical model in secret. The West Xia Dynasty Dead Book novel

On this night, the cold reading room of the资料室 was as usual only occupied by Ye Wenhui. In front of her, a pile of journals and literature was spread out on the long table. After completing a complex matrix calculation, she smiled with her frozen hands and closed a latest issue of the Journal of Astrophysics. She just flipped through it casually, and a paper about Jupiter research caught her attention. The abstract of the paper is as follows:

In the last issue's short message "New Strong Emission Source in the Solar System," Dr. Harry Biederman of the Wilson Mountain Observatory announced a batch of data related to his observations of Jupiter's rotation oscillation caused by planetary gravity on June 12 and July 2, where he unexpectedly detected strong electromagnetic radiation from Jupiter itself, with each duration lasting 81 seconds and 76 seconds. These data recorded the frequency range and other parameters of the radiation. During the radio burst period, some changes in the appearance of Jupiter's Great Red Spot were observed, and Biederman also described them in the short message. The radio burst of Jupiter has attracted great interest in the planetary academic community. In this issue, an article by G. MacKenzie believes that this is a sign of the start of Jupiter's internal thermonuclear fusion; the article by Inoue Yuhito in the next issue will summarize the mechanism of Jupiter's radio burst as a more complex one: the motion of internal metal hydrogen plates, and provides a complete mathematical description.

Yan Wenchao remembered those two dates and times clearly. At that time, the Red Beach listening system was severely affected by solar flare interference. She checked the operating log and confirmed her memory, but the electromagnetic radiation from the sun reaching the earth was 16 minutes and 42 seconds later than that from Jupiter. This crucial 16 minutes and 42 seconds! Yan Wenchao suppressed her pounding heart and asked the staff in the资料室 to contact the National Astronomical Observatory for the coordinates of Jupiter and the earth. She drew a large triangle on the blackboard, with the sun, the earth, and Jupiter as the three vertices. She labeled the distances on the three sides and marked the two arrival times at the earth's vertex. The time it took for electromagnetic radiation from Jupiter to reach the earth directly could be easily calculated based on the distance between Jupiter and the earth.

She then calculated the time it would take for electromagnetic radiation to travel from Jupiter to the Sun, from the Sun to Earth, and the two times were exactly 16 minutes and 42 seconds! Ye Wenjie took out the solar structure mathematical model she had created herself and tried to find some clues from theory. Her eyes quickly focused on a thing called "energy mirror" in the solar radiation layer. The energy emitted from the nuclear reaction region of the sun began as high-energy gamma rays, and the radiation region absorbed these high-energy particles and emitted energy to transmit energy, going through countless such repeated absorption and emission processes (a photon may take a thousand years to leave the sun). High-energy gamma rays pass through X-rays, ultraviolet rays, and ultraviolet rays to gradually become visible light and other forms of radiation. These are already well-established content in solar research. One new result of Ye Wenjie's mathematical model is that there are many obvious interfaces between different frequency radiations in the conversion process, and the radiation region expands from the inside out, and every time it crosses an interface, the radiation frequency drops significantly, which is different from the traditional view that the frequency of the radiation region is gradually changing. Calculations show that this interface can reflect radiation from the low-frequency side back, so she thought of that name.

Yan Wenchao began to carefully study the fluctuating films floating in the sun plasma ocean, layer by layer. She discovered that this thing that could only appear in the high-energy ocean of a star had many wonderful properties, of which the most incredible was its "gain reflection" characteristic. And this seemed to be related to the mystery of solar electromagnetic radiation, but this characteristic was too strange and difficult to verify. Yan Wenchao herself couldn't believe it, and it was more likely that some misleading results were produced in some dazzling complex calculations.

Now, Ye Wenjie has confirmed her猜想 about the enhancement reflection of solar energy mirror: the mirror is not simply reflecting low-frequency electromagnetic radiation, but amplifying it! The mysterious anomalies observed in the narrow frequency range were actually the result of the amplification of radiation from the universe. Therefore, there are no corresponding disturbances observed on the surface of the sun.

It is likely that the sun emitted the electromagnetic radiation again after receiving it from Jupiter, but the intensity increased by nearly a billion times. Earth received the two radiations with a time difference of 16 minutes and 42 seconds.
The sun is a radio amplifier!

There is a problem here: the sun receives electromagnetic radiation from space at all times, including radio waves from the Earth that have escaped, why does it only amplify some of it? The reason is obvious: in addition to the selection of reflection frequency by the energy mirror, it is mainly the screening effect of the convective layer on the sun. The convective layer, which is boiling all the time, is located above the radiation layer and is the outermost liquid layer of the sun. Radio waves from space must penetrate the convective layer to reach the energy mirror of the radiation layer, and then be amplified and reflected out. This requires that the incident radio waves have a power above a threshold. Most of the radio emissions on Earth are far below this threshold, but the electromagnetic radiation of Jupiter is above it - the maximum emission power of Red Rock is also above this threshold!

The issue of solar eclipses has not been resolved yet, but another exciting possibility has emerged: humans can use the sun as a super antenna and transmit electromagnetic waves into the universe through it. These waves are emitted with stellar energy, and their power is billions of times greater than the total power that can be emitted on Earth.
There is a possibility for Earth civilization to launch a Type II civilization energy level!
Next, the waveform of the two Jovian electromagnetic radiation should be compared with the waveform of the red岸受到的日凌干扰. If they match, this hypothesis will be further confirmed.

Yan Wenchao submitted a request to the leader, asking to contact Harry Bidson to obtain the waveform records of the two Jovian electromagnetic radiation. This was not an easy task, as the channels were hard to find, and there were numerous procedures to be passed through in various departments, and even a small mistake could lead to suspicions of external infiltration. Yan Wenchao had to wait.
But there is a more direct way to verify it: The Red Shore Radio System directly emits electromagnetic waves towards the sun with a power above the threshold.

Yan Wenchao found the leader and put forward this requirement, but she dared not express her own thoughts directly, because it was too mysterious and would definitely be rejected. She only said that it was a trial of studying the sun, using the Red Banner radar system as a detector for the sun, and analyzing some information about the electromagnetic radiation of the sun by receiving echoes. Lei Zhi Cheng and Yang Weining both had deep technical backgrounds, and it was not easy to fool them, but Yan Wenchao's proposed trial was actually a precedent in western sun research. In fact, this was simpler technically than the radar detection of planets similar to the earth that was being carried out at the time.
"Yan Wenhao, you're getting more and more out of line. Your project doesn't need to make such a big move. Is it necessary to do this?" Li Zhi Cheng shook his head and said.
"Commissar, there may be a major discovery. The experiment is necessary. Can we do it just this once?" Ye Wenjie begged desperately.
Yang Weining said, "General Lei, do we have to do it again? It seems not too difficult in terms of operation. The echo returns after the transmission and needs..."
"It will be about 15 minutes," said Lei Zhi Cheng.
"The Red岸系统正好有时间转换到接收状态。"

Le Zhi Cheng shook his head again, "I know that there is nothing in terms of technology and workload, but you, Mr. Yang, you are lacking the string in your mind - sending extremely powerful electric waves to the Red Sun, have you thought about the political implications of such an experiment?"

Yang Weining and Ye Wenjie were stunned, not because they thought the reason was absurd, but because they were afraid that they had not thought of it themselves. In those days, the political interpretation of everything had reached an extremely absurd level. Ye Wenjie's research report had to be carefully reviewed by Lei Zhi Cheng, who had to carefully review and modify the technical terms related to the sun, such as "sunspots." An experiment to send a super electric wave to the sun could have a thousand positive explanations, but as long as there was one negative explanation, someone might face a catastrophic fate. This was the reason why Lei Zhi Cheng refused the experiment, and it was impossible to refute it.

Yan Wenyi did not give up. In fact, it was not difficult to do this as long as there was not too much risk. The transmitter of the Red岸发射系统 is a device with extremely high power, all of which were domestically produced components during the "Cultural Revolution". Due to the poor quality, the failure rate was very high, so it was necessary to conduct comprehensive maintenance every fifteen times of发射, and after each maintenance, a routine test run had to be conducted. There were few people who participated in such launches, and the target and other launch parameters were also rather arbitrary.

During her shift, Ye Wenjie was assigned to conduct a routine test after maintenance. Due to the omission of many procedures during test firing, there were only five people on site, including three operators with little knowledge of device principles, and one technician and one engineer who had been exhausted and disengaged for two days of maintenance. Ye Wenjie first set the power output to just above the threshold value of the solar gain reflection theory (which was the maximum power output of the Red Beach firing system). She set the frequency to the frequency that was most likely to be amplified by the energy mirror, and used the test of antenna mechanical performance as an excuse to point it at the sun that was already slanting in the west. The content of the emission was still the same as that of each regular emission.

It was a clear afternoon in autumn of 1971. Afterward, Ye Wenjie recalled that moment many times, but she didn't feel anything special at the time. She was only anxious and eager for the launch to be completed as soon as possible. On the one hand, she was afraid that her colleagues on the scene would discover it, although she had prepared a plausible excuse. But conducting a launch experiment with the maximum power consumption of the electronic components was not normal. At the same time, the positioning device of the Red Banner launch system was not designed for aiming at the sun. Ye Wenjie could feel the optical system getting hot with her hand. If it were damaged, it would cause a lot of trouble. The sun was setting slowly in the west, and Ye Wenjie had to manually track it. At this time, the giant sunflower-like antenna of the Red Banner was slowly turning towards the descending sun. When the red light indicating the completion of the launch went on, she was already sweating all over. Turning her head, she saw that three operators were turning off the equipment in sequence on the control panel. The engineer was drinking water in a corner of the control room, and the technician was sleeping on a long chair. Whatever historians and literary figures may describe later, the true situation at the time was as plain and uneventful as that.
As soon as the launch was completed, Ye Wenjie rushed out of the control room and ran into Yang Weining's office, panting and saying, "Quickly, let the base radio station receive on 12000 MHz!"

"What do you want?" Yang Zhen, the chief engineer, looked at Ye Wenjie with surprise as her sweat-sticky hair clung to her face. In comparison with the highly sensitive Red Beach receiving system, the conventional military radio station used for communication with the outside world was just a toy.

"There may be something received, but the Red岸 system has no time to switch to the receiving state!" Ye Wenhui said. Normally, the preheating and switching of the Red岸 receiving system only takes about 15 minutes, but the receiving system is also under maintenance now, and many modules have been disassembled and not assembled, so it is impossible to operate within a short time. Yang Weining looked at Ye Wenhui for a few seconds and picked up the phone, instructing the secretariat communication room to do as Ye Wenhui said. "The accuracy of that radio station is only able to receive signals from extraterrestrial aliens on the moon."
"The signal comes from the sun," Ye Wenjie said. Outside, the edge of the sun was approaching the peak of the mountain, a deep red.
"Did you send a signal to the sun with the Red Shore system?" Yang Weining asked nervously.
Yan Wenjie nodded.
"Don't tell anyone about this. This is the last time, absolutely the last time!" Yang Weining警惕地回头看看门口说.
Yan Wenzhe nodded again.
"What's the meaning of this? The echo must be extremely weak, far beyond the reception capabilities of conventional radio stations."

"No, if my guess is correct. It will receive extremely strong echoes, so strong that... it's unimaginable. As long as the transmission power exceeds a certain threshold, the sun... can amplify the radio waves by billions!"

Yang Weining looked at Ye Wenhui again, who was silent. The two of them waited quietly, and Yang Weining could clearly hear Ye Wenhui's breathing and heartbeat. He didn't pay much attention to what she had said just now, but the emotions that had been buried for so many years surged up in his heart again. But he could only control himself and wait. Twenty minutes later, Yang Weining picked up the phone and called the communications room. He asked a few simple questions briefly.
"Nothing received." Yang Weining hung up the phone and said.
Yan Wenhao took a deep breath and nodded after a long while.

"The American astronomer replied." Yang Weining handed a thick envelope to Ye Wenjie, who eagerly opened it. Inside were two stacks of paper with detailed records of electromagnetic radiation from Jupiter. The waves were clearly copied from long strips of signal record paper, and had to be aligned to read. At that time, most Chinese people had not seen a copy machine. Ye Wenjie lined up dozens of copied papers on the floor in two rows, but by the time she had reached the halfway point, she had given up all hope. She was too familiar with the waveforms of the two times of solar eclipse interference, and they were definitely not aligned with these two.

Yan Wenjie slowly picked up the two rows of copied paper from the ground. Yang Weining knelt down to help her pick them up. When he handed her a pack of papers in his hand, he saw her shake her head and laugh. The laugh was sad and made his heart tremble.
"What?" he asked softly, not realizing that he had ever spoken to her so softly before.

"There's nothing, just a dream. It was just a dream." Yeh Weijie smiled and walked out of the office with the stack of copied papers and envelopes. She returned to her residence and got her lunch box to go to the cafeteria. However, she found that there was only steamed buns and pickles left. The cafeteria staff told her that they were closing, so she had to leave with her lunch box. As she walked out, she came to the cliff and sat on the grass, eating the cold steamed buns.

The sun had already set, and the Great Altai Mountains appeared as a dull gray expanse, just like Ye Wenjie's life. In this gray, dreams were especially brilliant and dazzling. But dreams always wake up quickly, just like that sun, although it will rise again, it no longer carries new hope. At this time, Ye Wenjie suddenly saw her latter life, and it was only an endless gray. She含着眼泪, and then smiled again, and continued to gnaw on cold steamed buns.

Yan Wenchao didn't know that at this time, the first cry of humanity that could be heard in space had already taken off from the center of the sun at light speed and was heading towards the entire universe with a powerful radio wave of solar-type power. The mighty wave of radio waves, like a mighty tide, had already crossed the orbit of Jupiter.
At this time, the Sun is the brightest star in the Milky Way at 12000 megahertz.
